thread.title: Pirates party with pioneers and steampunks at Time Travelers' Ball (photos)
thread.title_full: Pirates party with pioneers and steampunks at Time Travelers' Ball (photos) | OregonLive.com

author: Dillon Pilorget | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Pirates party with pioneers and steampunks at Time Travelers' Ball (photos)
text:
Pirates and pioneers mingled with medieval maidens at the Hillsboro Historical Society's annual Time Travelers' Ball fundraiser Oct. 10 at the Odd Fellows Hall downtown.
A day of anachronistic events included lessons in historical European martial arts and international folk dance. But the main event was the evening's ball, where the finest formal wear from across the centuries flounced as the wearers learned an English country dance.
Among those reveling in their retro regalia throughout the day were Sarah and Gabriel Chrisman, the Washington couple that's caught the nation's attention in recent years for attempting to live as though it was still the Victorian era . Sarah Chrisman was the event's keynote speaker earlier in the evening.
Though the couple had to leave the festivities before the ball, organizer Kay Demlow said the Chrismans were kindred spirits among the other anachronists in attendance. And it's this costumed camaraderie that brings Joe Christensen, a steelworker from Beaverton, to the ball.
"Nobody's mocking anybody" for their occasionally outlandish dress, he said. Everyone buys in and stays open to the experience, which makes for an irresistible atmosphere for Christensen and his wife, Roberta.
And by the looks of everyone else at the ball, there was no place - or time - they'd have rather been either.
-- Dillon Pilorget
